sentences.en: a man of eminent good sense
An eminent anthropologist , Fred Gelman investigated the remnants of ancient structures.
sentences.cn: 一位著名人类学家弗莱德·吉尔曼探查过古建筑的遗迹.

sentences.en: Churchil was one of the world's most eminent statesmen.
sentences.cn: 邱吉尔是世界上最卓越的政治家之一.

sentences.en: Dickens was pre-eminent among English writers of his day.
sentences.cn: 狄更斯在其同时期英国作家中最为出色。

sentences.en: For a decade "X" was the pre-eminent punk band in Los Angeles.
sentences.cn: 10年来，“X”乐队一直都是洛杉矶最杰出的朋克乐队。
他在科学家中是闻名的.

sentences.en: He is eminent both as a sculptor and as a portrait painter.
sentences.cn: 他既是着名的雕刻家又是杰出的肖像画家.
他从前是个有名的扒手.

sentences.en: Let us have a look at New Jersey's pre - eminent University Town.
sentences.cn: 让我们看看新泽西出类拔萃的大学城.

sentences.en: Roast beef stood eminent behind the souffle and champagne.
sentences.cn: 在蛋奶酥和香滨酒后面的烤牛排是很引人注目的.

sentences.en: The judge was a man of eminent fairness.
sentences.cn: 这位法官是非常公正的人.

sentences.en: The order was created in 1902 as a special distinction for eminent men and women.
sentences.cn: 该勋位设立于1902年，作为一项殊荣授予杰出的男性和女性。

sentences.en: The pre - eminent translator of the Spanish language has never been to Spain.
sentences.cn: 这位出色的西班牙语翻译家却从没到过西班牙.

sentences.en: This attracted the attention of Richard Humphries who was then the most eminent boxer in England.
sentences.cn: 这引起了当时英国拳坛名将理查德.汉弗莱斯的注意.

sentences.en: We are expecting the arrival of an eminent scientist.
sentences.cn: 我们正期待一位著名科学家的来访.

phrases.tran_cn: [律]土地征用权；国家最高支配权

trans.tran_en: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected
